title: unfaithfulness
comment: The failure to fulfil the obligations of a relationship, resulting in disloyalty to God and to others.

children.title: unfaithfulness, to God
children.comment: In the OT the terms of the covenant with God were constantly broken by Israel by acts of idolatry and disobedience. The consequence was God's judgment, which eventually included exile.

primaryrefs.comment: The covenant between God and Israel at Sinai viewed in terms of a marriage contract

children.title: Unfaithfulness seen in other forms of disobedience
Unfaithfulness as a characteristic of God's people throughout the OT
Unfaithful kings
children.precomment: Solomon's unfaithfulness leads to unfaithfulness among his subjects:

primaryrefs.comment: God's purpose through the exile is to bring about the eventual repentance and restoration of his people.

children.title: unfaithfulness, to people
children.comment: A breach of the trust that is expected within specific relationships, and also a failure of mutual responsibility within a community life; the breaking of the last six of the Ten Commandments.

children.title: Unfaithfulness to one another breaks God's commandments
The seriousness of marital unfaithfulness
children.precomment: Adultery in the OT punishable by death:

children.title: God's people may face opposition from their families
Unfaithfulness to Jesus Christ during his earthly ministry
Jesus Christ deserted by his followers

secondaryrefs.comment: Ish-Bosheth assassinated by Recab and Baanah
David has Uriah killed in battle
